result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan R Contreras

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Defendant - per 12/20/16 Judmgent of Dismissal. 17C 010638
to Dismiss  cc: DA (electronically) , Atty Severson, Defendant  /tn 12-20-16
of Case Acceptance into the First Offender Program for 12 months
Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment and Order for Dismissal
with elements and criminal case settlement

[MK] cases #15CM146 and #15CM192 called at 1:56pm. 
Defendant Juan Contreras in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Contreras, verifying that he understands and joins in the agreement. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1 of Case #15CM146 and on Count #2 of Case #15CM192; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.

In Case #15CM146 the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Contreras guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
 Domestic Abuse finding made. 
In Case #15CM192 the Court accepts the plea, but withholds the finding of guilt and the entry of any judgment.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts in both files [Count #2 in Case 15CM146, and Counts #1 & #3 in Case 15CM192.]
 

On Case #15CM146, Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Contreras to pay a fine of $200 plus costs = $705, plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge= $805 minus the $150 cash bond posted= $655 due, to be paid in $50 per month payments commencing on 11/30/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in 14 days in the County Jail, consecutive. 
The Court requires Mr. Nissen to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for DNA sample provision. 

On Case #15CM192, Count #2, the Court approves and adopts the Deferred Prosecution Agreement as its Order. 
recess 2:19pm.
Proposed stip and order for continuance
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant

Cases 15CM146 & 15CM192 recalled together at 1:18 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Juan R Contreras in court with Attorney Brian Severson, who appears via telephone. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds audio technology is working properly for purposes of these proceedings
Court reviews earlier hearing/non-appearance - Court vacates warrants in each case
Atty Severson requests matters be set on the trial - no resolution at this time
Counsel agree 1 day is needed for each trial & that they should be tried separately
Court informs parties that It will set same Final Status date, but different jury trial dates
ADA Beck requests that the 146 case be heard first for trial
Recess: 1:22 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule FSSC 9/15/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices 
15CM146: Schedule JT 9/21/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
15CM192: Schedule JT 9/22/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Cases 15CM146 & 15CM192 called together at 11:18 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Brian Severson in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock requests warrants in each matter
Atty Severson - have had recent contact with Mr. Contreras, has not missed any prior hearings - we're going to request matters for trial. Requests warrants be stayed.
Court orders issuance of bench warrant in each case and STAYS warrants until  2:00 pm on Monday, July 27th.
Recess: 11:22 am

Case called at 11:04am [mo]
Defendant Juan R Contreras in court with Attorney Brian Severson .   ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Bond arguments given by Counsel

The Court reduces the cash bond to $500, the remainder is to be returned to Mr. Contreras, with the added condtions: 
--no acts or threats of violence toward anyone
--No contact with Denise Long
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 11:11am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on July 8, 2015 at 8:40am    (2)  Status Conference on July 24, 2015 at 11:00am
